intro: Arsenococcus ligustrinus, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, white or pale purple flowers and elliptical, silver-green leaves. The plant belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and peppers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands. Due to its toxic properties, it is not recommended for cultivation in gardens.
